707580f-b.title: Manhattan: 1st Ave. - 35th St. E.
707580f-b.text:
(1)
First Ave., west side, north from, and including East 35th to, and
includine East 36th Streets. Also shown is East 36th Street,
(across St. Gabriel's Park), north side, west from First, to and in-
cluding Second Aves. A general view of mid-town Manhattan appears
and shows, from left to right, 10 Nast 40th Street, 4O East 41st
Street, Lincoln, Chanin, Chrysler and the Daily News Buildings.
April 27, 1930.
P. L. Sxrr.
NO REPRODUCTIONS.
(2)
The same, from a different angle.
April 6. 1931.
P. L. Sperr.
NO REPRODUCTIONS.

707579f-a.title: Manhattan: 1st Ave. - 35th St. E.
707579f-a.text:
First Avenue, west side, north from E. 35th Street, showing
the easterly end of St. Gabriel's Park extending to 36th Street.
The buildings appearing on the latter thoroughfare will be razed
in June for the Queens Midtown Tunnel. Across the roofs of same,
from left to right, appear the Chrysler, News, and Tudor City
buildings.
January 7, 1939
Sonach Photo Service
New York City Tunnel Aut)ority
CREDIT LINE IMPERAIVE

707578f-a.title: Manhattan: 1st Ave. - 35th St. E.
707578f-a.text:
(1)
Firet Ave., west side, north from East 35th Street. Also shown
(across St. Gabriel's Park) is East 36th Street, at, adjoining and west
of the N.W. corner of First Ave.
April 8, 1931.
P. L. Sperr.
NO REPRODUCTIONS.
(2)
The same, north from and including East 36th Street. Spired buildings
shown are a portion of Tudor City.
April 8, 1936.
P. L. Sperr.
NO REPRODUCTIONS.
(3)
The same as No. 2.
October 12, 1936.
P. L. Sperr.
NO REPRODUCTIONS.

707575f.title: Manhattan: 1st Ave. - 35th St. E.
707575f.text:
First Avenue, at the S. E. corner of E. 35th Street, showing
an automobile juhk yard. The avenue is on the left and 35th Street
runs across the top. A limited part of the N. Y. Steam Co. plant
appears on the north side of same.
1939
Alexander Alland
NO REPRODUCTIO1S
This photo is one of a series that appeared in the published volume
''Portrait of N. Y.' by F.lix Reisenberg and Alex. Alland, IROV.

723097f-a.title: Manhattan: 1st Avenue - 35th Street (East)
723097f-a.text:
(1)
St. Gabriel's Park, looking N.W. across the Rark from 35th Street
vest of First Avenue. The five-story building on 36th Street is
St. Gabriel's School; to the right of it may be seen the spire of
St. Cabriel's Roman Catholic Church, which is on the south side of
37th Street.
The Ch ysler Building, Lexington Avenue ano 42nd Street, is almost
oirectly in line with the church. The Chanin Building (172 East
42nd Street) and the Lincoln Building (60 East 42nd Street) rise
on the horizon behind the school.
June 14, 1934.
P. L. Sperr.
NO REPRODUCTIONS.
(2)
A view of the western portion of the Park under improvement. Across
aame appears St. Gabriels Hall and the St. Gabriels Branch of the NewEYork
Public Library; both on 36th Street. Second Ave. (shown with elevated
thereon) is the western boundary. Prominent structures, not shown in
No. 1 are, 10 East 40th Street, and the Lefcourt Colonial.
April 8, 1936.
L. Sperr.
NO REPRODUCTIONS.
